page.title: 19 FOLKESTONE: M.V.HENGIST
page.content: M.V.Hengist is one of three Sealink ships on the Folkestone-Boulogne service. The others are the Horsa and the Vortigern. The ships are named after the Saxon kings of the ancient kingdom of Kent. The Hengist weighs 4800 tons and is 360 feet long. She has a passenger capacity of 1500 and vehicle space for 210 cars or 22 large lorries. The ship is powered by two diesel engines, each of which burns 500 litres of fuel every hour. Hengist is capable of travelling at 18 knots, and the average cross-Channel journey time is an hour and a three-quarters. Since being in service it is estimated that the Hengist has made some 16000 Channel crossings. During 1985 Sealink became Sealink British Ferries and the ship is painted in the new colours of blue and white.
